Description: Complete scarab, made of glazed steatite. The steatite is of a beige colour, few remains of a whitish glaze is preserved. The division between head and prothorax is indicated by a line as is the division between prothorax and elytra. The suture is shown by a single line as well, the humeral callosities are indicated by incised triangles. The head is of an oval shape, no eyes are visible. The clypeus is shown without details, framed by two outer lines. The side of the scarab shows three carved legs on each side, without details, sitting on top of the baseplate. The seal at the base shows an thin oval line framing the base, with several hieroglyphs. On the left a squatting sphinx with wings, beard and uraeus, over the head a sun disc with two uraei. In front ofit a cartouche of Mn-kheper-R', and the hieroglyphs of 'Imn-R' around it. The orientation of the sealing is transversal while the perforation is longitudinal.
